name: Jimmy McCracklin
description: '''James David Walker Jr.''' (August 13, 1921 – December 20, 2012), better known by his stage name '''Jimmy McCracklin''', was an American pianist, singer, and songwriter. His style contained [[West Coast blues]], [[Jump blues]], and R&B. Over a career that spanned seven decades, he said he had written almost a thousand songs and had recorded hundreds of them. McCracklin recorded over 30 albums, and earned four [[music recording sales certification|gold records]]. Tom Mazzolini of the [[San Francisco Blues Festival]] said of him, "He was probably the most important musician to come out of the Bay Area in the post-World War II years."
